text: Daniel Bevilacqua, (13 October 1945 â€“ 16 April 2020), better known by the stage name Christophe, was a French singer-songwriter, keyboardist and record producer. He was born in the Paris. Christophe became famous in the early 1960s with his first hit being "Aline". In 1971, with Francis Dreyfus, he created the Motors record label (Disques Motors). He wrote the song "Boule de flipper" for Corynne Charby. Christophe was hospitalized under critical condition for COVID-19 and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease in Paris.
